titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Kathleen George Papers, 1962-2014 CTC.2012.02
titlestmt.author: William Daw.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:58:50 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: Kathleen George is a professor in the Theatre Arts Department at the University of Pittsburgh and an accomplished author. This collection contains drafts of her books and short stories, along with the research and promotional materials related to these works. Materials representing her 30 plus years of teaching can also be found in the collection.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gifts donated by Kathleen George in 2012-2014.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection documents Kathleen George's lifelong passion for teaching and creative writing. The papers include materials relating to the creation and publishing of all of her creative works, along with files related to her academic career, primarily at the University of Pittsburgh.

Related to her academic career, the collection contains materials on many of the courses that she taught. There is also documentation for the Pitt theatre productions that she directed and her work with the Semester at Sea program.

The largest group of materials are related to Dr. George's literary works. There are many different varieties of output for her writing â€“ academic articles, theatre reviews, book reviews, short fiction, academic and instructional text books, novels, etc. All of Dr. George's unpublished works are also contained in the collection and are available for use.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by William Daw, Claire Cohen, and Kaley Kilpatrick in 2013-2014.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The papers are organized into four series.
Series II. Correspondence and Other Materials, 1964-2009

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Kathleen George Papers, 1962-2014, CTC.2012.02, Curtis Theatre Collection, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Kathleen George Papers, 1962-2014, CTC.2012.02, Curtis Theatre Collection, Special Collections Department, University of Pittsburgh.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Kathleen George was born in Johnstown, Pennsylvania, in 1943. She attended college at the University of Pittsburgh's Johnstown campus for several years before transferring to Pitt's main campus in 1963. She received her bachelor of arts in English with an emphasis on creative writing in 1964, and her Master's degree in Theatre Arts in 1966. Afterwards, she took an assistant professor position at Carlow College (1968-1976). In 1975, she completed her PhD in Theatre from Pitt and the next year became an associate professor there. Throughout the 1980s and 90s she directed many productions for the University of Pittsburgh Repertory Theatre and the Three Rivers Shakespeare Festival. Also, during this time she published two academic works, her dissertation Rhythm in Drama and Playwriting: the First Workshop.

Kathleen had been writing since she was a teenager and in 1988, she completed a second Masters of Fine Arts degree in creative writing. Her first of many published short stories was Country Tale in the journal Valhalla, in the fall of 1980. Throughout the eighties and nineties, she continued to have her short fiction published in a variety of journals. This culminated in the 1999 publication of a collection of these short stories, The Man in the Buick. Since then, Kathleen has found great success with a series of novels featuring Pittsburgh Police detective Richard Christie. The Odds, the fourth book in the series, was nominated for an Edgar award for best novel of 2009 by the Mystery Writers of America.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: No restrictions other than Box 20, Folders 5-11 which will be closed until 2040.

controlaccess.corpname: University of Pittsburgh. Department of Theatre Arts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials related to Kathleen George's academic career. While the vast majority of the files are centered around her faculty position here at the University of Pittsburgh, there are a few files that relate to her time as an assistant professor at Carlow College. The series is divided into four subseries - Directing, Semester at Sea, Student Plays, and Teaching and Advising.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Dr. George has directed over a dozen productions for the University of Pittsburgh Repertory Theatre. This includes several productions for the Three Rivers Shakespeare Festival. Materials incorporated into each production's section include scripts, research files, audition forms, rehearsal information, slides, set designs, reviews, etc. The sections are arranged in chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: University of Pittsburgh Theatre's production of The Rehearsal ran at the Stephen Foster Memorial Theatre March 10-26, 1977.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: University of Pittsburgh Theatre's production of The Country Wife ran at the Stephen Foster Memorial Theatre March 3-18, 1978.

did.unittitle: Report on Restoration Comedy by Dr. Wandalie Henshaw and Kathy George

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: University of Pittsburgh Theatre's production of Much Ado About Nothing ran at the Stephen Foster Memorial Theatre November 1-17, 1978. It was a very popular production and was revived the next season as well as making it to the semi-finals of the American College Theatre Festival competition.

did.unittitle: Faculty of Arts and Sciences grants committee application
Pennsylvania Council on the Arts stipend and contact list

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Kathleen George served as Associate Professor for the Semester at Sea study abroad program in the spring of 1984. In the Fall of 1987, she was the Academic Dean of the program. This subseries contains materials related to the curriculum during these semesters, memos, reports, and information on some of the cities that were visiting during the voyages. Also included in the subseries is one folder of materials from the Spring semester of 1995, where she was an Associate Professor for the Pitt in London program.

did.unittitle: China and Japan - Articles and notes
Port information - Brochures and fact sheets

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Kathleen George began teaching playwriting courses at the University of Pittsburgh in the mid-1980s. This series collects all the student written plays from these courses that were staged in some form. Some of these plays were a part of the New Play Practicum and Lunchtime Theatre series of productions. In most instances, only the script is present. Also included are different drafts of the play, copies of the script with annotations by Kathleen, rehearsal information, etc. The files are arranged alphabetically by the author.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains materials related to Kathleen George various responsibilities as part of the faculty of the Theatre Arts Department at the University of Pittsburgh. There are files dealing with courses taught, dissertation committees, student playwriting and productions, teaching evaluations, department memos, yearly reports, etc. There are also several items from here time teaching at Carlow College.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Included in this series is a small amount of correspondence and a few other files that are not directly related to Kathleen George's academic or writing work. Within the correspondence files are letters from colleagues such as Bert O. States and Montgomery Culver. Also included are reader's reports for the University of Pittsburgh Press, copies of her curriculum vitae from different points of her career, and information files on some of her mentors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains all the materials related to Kathleen George's literary works and creative writing. The series is divided into four subseries - Newspaper and magazine articles, Published Works, Unpublished works, and Writing related.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Contained in this section are essays, columns, reviews, etc. by Kathleen George in newspapers or magazines. The book reviews are mainly from the Pittsburgh City Paper or the Pittsburgh Post Gazette. George has published several essays or columns, the majority of which appeared in the Pittsburgh Post Gazette. Some were featured in the Books on Sunday section and are autobiographical in nature.

did.unittitle: Feature on Pittsburgh restaurants in George's novelsTable Magazine

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Please see oversized series for more newspaper articles about George.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Please see oversized series for more newspaper articles by George.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains materials related to Dr. George's published short stories and monographs. The academic works, short story collections, and novels are arranged in chronological order by their publication date. Each title's files contains drafts, marketing materials, reviews, correspondence with the publisher, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: An Actor Prepares was published in the May/June & July/August 1998 issue of North American Review (Vol.283 no.3&4). The story also received an honorable mention in the Salt Hill Journal's annual fiction contest.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Heartbreak House was published in the Fall 2000 issue of New Letters (Vol.67 no.1).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: A Week in Summer was published 2006 by Amazon.com. The short story is available as part of the Amazon Shorts section of Amazon.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Chill was published in the March 2010 issue of Spirit Magazine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Rhythm in Drama was published by the University of Pittsburgh Press in 1980. This work was adapted from Dr. George's dissertation. In 1986, it was also published by the Shanghai Drama Institute in Chinese.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Playwriting: The First Workshop was published by Focal Press in 1994. The text book replicates a workshop experience in developing playwriting skills.

unittitle.title: The Man in the Buick and Other Stories

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Man in the Buick and Other Stories was published in 1999 by the BkMk Press, in association with the University of Missouri-Kansas City. Nearly all of the short stories contained in the book had been previously published in various journals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The novel Taken was published by Delacorte Press in May of 2001. Drafts of this work were titled Pirate's Child. This is the first of several novels that center around the character of Pittsburgh Police detective Richard Christie.

did.unittitle: Use in University of Pittsburgh English composition course

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The suspense novel Fallen was published in 2004 by Dell. Earlier versions of this work are titled Grief.

unittitle.title: Winter's Tales: Reflections on the Novelistic Stage

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Winter's Tales: Reflections on the Novelistic Stage was published in 2005 by the University of Delaware Press. This academic work examines the similarities between novels and plays that take place over a long time period.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Odds was published in 2009 by Thomas Dunne Books, an imprint of St. Martin's Press. The book was nominated for an Edgar Allen Poe award for best novel of the year by the Mystery Writers of America. Drafts of this work are titled Kids or Hooked.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Please see oversized series for the certificate of nomination.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Pittsburgh Noir was published in June 2011 by Akashic Books. The work is a part of the popular Akashic noir series. Kathleen George contributed a short story in addition to editing the book.

scopecontent.p: The suspense novel Hideout was published in August 2011 by Minotaur Books. Earlier versions of this work are titled Old Bird.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Simple was published in 2012 by Minotaur Books.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: A Measure of Blood was published by MysteriousPress.com. It was released on January 14, 2014. Prior to publication, this work was titled And So I'm Leaving.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Johnstown Girls was published by the University of Pittsburgh Press. It was released on April 1, 2014. Kathleen George's goal of writing a novel involving the Johnstown Flood was started about twenty-five years earlier. The drafts of that earlier work are in the Johnstown Stories section of the Unpublished Works subseries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains materials related to Dr. George's un-published works. The subseries are arranged in alphabetical order by title. Each title's files contains drafts, research materials, etc.

scopecontent.p: This unfinished novel is an expansion of the published short story Too Much Woman. The work also sometimes referred to or titled after its main character Willa or Willa, the Way She Dances.

did.unittitle: Incomplete draft with notes and research

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Kathleen George began a project to write a story related to the Johnstown Flood as its two hundredth anniversary approached. The anniversary passed and she continued to work and re-work the project over the next twenty plus years. Sometimes the work was simply titled Johnstown Stories, other times as Birth Offerings. In 2014, The Johnstown Girls was published by the University of Pittsburgh Press. The book's release coincided with the Flood's two hundred and twenty fifth anniversary. For drafts and other materials of The Johnstown Girls see the novel's section in the Published Works subseries.

did.unittitle: Drafts - Incomplete handwritten drafts and outlines

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Rites of Burial was Kathleen George's first attempt to collect several of short stories into one publication. Early drafts of this work are titled Birth Offerings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This unpublished work is a collection of personal essays on narrative and drama.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Within this subseries are materials related to Kathleen George's writing career. These files are not related to a specific work, but do illustrate the immense amount of work that is also required after a work has been written. Included are grant applications, fellowship and award submissions, materials on various writing colonies, conferences, short fiction journal submissions, etc.
